title: How to Make Baked Crescent Churros

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a microwave-safe bowl for about 30-40 seconds.
Measure and mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a small bowl.
Unroll the dough on a cutting board.
steps.description: Separate it into 4 rectangles or 2 triangular pieces that are attached together. Make sure that the seams are sealed together.

steps.headline: Use a basting brush, coat the 2 rectangular pieces of dough with a light layer of butter.
Sprinkle about half of the sugar/cinnamon mix onto the buttered dough.
Place the other two dough rectangles on top of the buttered ones, as if you were making a sandwich.
Use a pizza cutter or sharp knife and cut the dough into 5 or 6 thin strips, lengthwise.
Take each strip and carefully twist it 3-4 times.
steps.description: Place the strips on a greased cookie sheet.

steps.headline: Bake for 11-13 minutes, or until golden brown.
Brush the tops with any remaining butter and sugar/cinnamon mixture.

text: Preparation Preheat the oven to 375ºF, or 190ºC.  Melt the butter in a microwave-safe bowl for about 30-40 seconds. Place on the side. Measure and mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a small bowl.  Preparing the Dough Unroll the dough on a cutting board. Separate it into 4 rectangles or 2 triangular pieces that are attached together. Make sure that the seams are sealed together. Use a basting brush, coat the 2 rectangular pieces of dough with a light layer of butter.  Sprinkle about half of the sugar/cinnamon mix onto the buttered dough.  Place the other two dough rectangles on top of the buttered ones, as if you were making a sandwich.  Use a pizza cutter or sharp knife and cut the dough into 5 or 6 thin strips, lengthwise.  Take each strip and carefully twist it 3-4 times. Place the strips on a greased cookie sheet. Baking the Crescent Churros Bake for 11-13 minutes, or until golden brown.  Brush the tops with any remaining butter and sugar/cinnamon mixture.  Serve hot or warm.
